body: @fmeum Do you think you could take a look?

issue.title: Don't use `environ` on Windows

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Since Bazel uses `wmain`, `environ` is typically `null` until the first call to `getenv()`. This call has been removed in 1744d45c0c57af23f631c2145e8af4b185dca77f, so this usage could result in a crash.

Fixes #26948

body: @AlexanderGolovlev I sent out https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/26948, could you check whether this fixes the crash?

> [@AlexanderGolovlev](https://github.com/AlexanderGolovlev) I sent out [#26948](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/26948), could you check whether this fixes the crash?

https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/26948?

Oops, didn't mean to recurse there :⁠-⁠)

https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/26993 is the PR I meant to reference

Thank you, Fabian!
I tested your changes on latest master, and it indeed fixes the crash. The server starts successfully and performs the build.

However, building the examples gives me the errors like following:
```
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:5:11: //examples/cpp:hello-lib: no such attribute 'srcs' in 'cc_library' rule
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:5:11: //examples/cpp:hello-lib: no such attribute 'hdrs' in 'cc_library' rule
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:11:10: //examples/cpp:hello-world: no such attribute 'srcs' in 'cc_binary' rule
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:11:10: //examples/cpp:hello-world: no such attribute 'deps' in 'cc_binary' rule
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:17:8: //examples/cpp:hello-success_test: no such attribute 'srcs' in 'cc_test' rule
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:17:8: //examples/cpp:hello-success_test: no such attribute 'deps' in 'cc_test' rule
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:17:8: In rule 'hello-success_test', size '' is not a valid size.
ERROR: C:/github/bazelbuild/examples/cpp/BUILD:17:8: In rule 'hello-success_test', timeout '' is not a valid timeout.
```
This worked fine on 8.3.1 branch. I guess, this is not related to current issue.
This is probably related to the custom build not embedding a version string, which then results in different behavior for autoloading core rules. We can test this properly once the first RC is out.

issue.title: [8.5.0] Don't use `environ` on Windows

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Since Bazel uses `wmain`, `environ` is typically `null` until the first call to `getenv()`. This call has been removed in 1744d45c0c57af23f631c2145e8af4b185dca77f, so this usage could result in a crash.

Fixes #26948

Closes #26993.

(cherry picked from commit ef8b1d28d7b704fbe25134869e04d8ca6ed1f8d5)

Closes #26994
